wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[2 January|2]]''' - ''[[The Art of The Return of the King]]'' is published.
* '''[[2 January|2]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Complete Visual Companion]]'' is published.
* '''[[5 January|5]]''' - Graphic novel ''[[Heaven's War]]'' is published.
* '''[[7 January|7]]''' - Dutch translator [[Willy Wielek-Berg]] dies.

==February==
* '''[[5 February|5]]''' - [[Andy Serkis]] wins an [[wikipedia:Empire Awards|Empire Award]] in the category ''Best British Actor'', for his role as [[Gollum]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]].
* '''[[22 February|22]]''' - At the [[wikipedia:10th Screen Actors Guild Awards|10th Screen Actors Guild Awards]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'' wins the award for "Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture".
* '''[[25 February|25]]''' -  ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game|The Two Towers Anthology]]'' is released by [[Decipher]].
* '''[[29 February|29]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'' wins 11 Oscars at the [[wikipedia:76th Academy Awards|76th Academy Awards]]. 
==March==
* '''[[16 March|16]]''' - ''[[The World of Tolkien]]'' is published.
==April==
* '''[[30 April|30]]''' - ''[[Tolkien Studies: Volume 1]]'' is published.
==May==
* '''[[1 May|1]]''' - ''[[There and Back Again: In the Footsteps of J.R.R. Tolkien's England]]'' is published.
* '''[[15 May|15]]-[[16 May|16]]''' - [[Tolkien Weekend 2004]] at [[Sarehole Mill]].
* '''[[24 May|24]]''' - ''[[Understanding The Lord of the Rings]]'' is published.

==June==
*'''[[3 June|3]]-[[5 June|5]]''' - [[Lord of the Rings Symphony]] in Atlanta, GA, Atlanta Symphony Hall
* '''[[30 June|30]]''' - ''[[War and the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' is published.
==July==
* '''[[1 July|1]]-[[2 July|2]]''' - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Houston, TX, Jones Hall.
* '''[[10 July|10]]''' - German translator Hans J. Sch√ºtz dies.
* '''[[13 July|13]]''' - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Philadelphia, PA, Mann Center
* '''[[13 July|13]]-[[15 July|15]]''' - [[Tolkien Thing|Tolkien Thing VI]]
* '''[[15 July|15]]-[[17 July|17]]''' - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Seattle, WA, S.Mark Taper Auditorium/Benaroya Hall
* '''[[29 July|29]]-[[31 July|31]]''' - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Pittsburgh, PA, Heinz Hall 
* '''[[30 July|30]]''' - [[Mythcon 35]] begins.
* '''?''' - [[Vinyar Tengwar 46]] is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Translating Tolkien: Text and Film]]'' is published.

==August==
* '''[[2 August|2]]''' - [[Mythcon 35]] ends.
*'''[[12 August|12]]''' - [[Peter Woodthorpe]], who voiced [[Gollum]] in both [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)]] as well as [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|The Lord of the Rings 1981 radio series]], dies.
==September==
* '''[[15 September|15]]''' - A new Swedish translation of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', made by [[Erik Andersson]], is published.
* '''[[17 September|17]]-[[19 September|19]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2004]].
*'''[[18 September|18]]-[[19 September|19]]''' - ''Lord of the Rings Symphony'' in Hartford, CT, Mortensen Hall.
* '''[[23 September|23]]''' - ''[[There and Back Again: An Actor's Tale]]'', in which [[Sean Astin]] describes the shooting of [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]] from his perspective, is published.
* '''[[27 September|27]]''' - [[Parma Eldalamberon 15]] is published.
* '''[[28 September|28]]''' - The parody book ''[[The Sillymarillion]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Peter Jackson: From Gore to Mordor]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[When a Fan Hits the Shit|When a Fan Hits the Shit: The Rise and Fall of a Phony Charity]]'' is published.

==October==
* '''[[8 October|8]]-[[9 October|9]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Symphony]]'' in Chicago, IL, Auditorium Theatre.
* '''[[12 October|12]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Symphony]]'' in Milwaukee, WI.
* '''[[21 October|21]] - The [[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)|50th Anniversary Edition]] of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is published.'''

==November==
* '''[[2 November|2]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]'' is released in North America.
* '''[[5 November|5]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]'' is released in Europe.
* '''[[6 November|6]]''' - [[User:Hyarion|Hyarion]] purchases the domain [[Tolkien Gateway:About|TolkienGateway.net]]
* '''[[8 November|8]]''' - [[David Salo]]'s ''[[A Gateway to Sindarin]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - [[Mithril Armoury]] files for [[wikipedia:Chapter 7, Title 11, United States Code|Chapter 7]] bankruptcy. 
==December==
* '''[[3 December|3]]-[[4 December|4]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Symphony]]'' plays in [[wikipedia:Newark, New Jersey|Newark, New Jersey]]. 
* '''[[14 December|14]]''' - [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (extended edition)]] is released on DVD.
* '''[[22 December|22]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]'' is released in Japan.
* '''[[26 December|26]]''' - Actor [[Garard Green]] dies.

==?==
* '''?''' - ''[[2005 An Elvish Travel Calendar]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Siege of Gondor (book)|The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Siege of Gondor]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[The Battle of Pelennor Fields|The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Battle of Pelennor Fields]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Tolkien's Golem]]'' is published.
